title: 113_hr1750
content: The Act may be cited as the "Community Lending Enhancement and Regulatory Relief Act of 2013" or the "CLEAR Relief Act of 2013". The table of contents for this Act is provided. The "Community Lending Enhancement and Regulatory Relief Act of 2013" includes changes to small bank holding company policy statement on assessment of financial and managerial factors, escrow requirements, exceptions to annual privacy notice requirement, accounting principles cost-benefit requirements, community bank exemption from Sarbanes-Oxley Act, certain loans as qualified mortgages, increase in small servicer exemption, appraiser qualification threshold, and coordination among financial institutions. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System will propose revisions to the Small Bank Holding Company Policy Statement to apply to bank holding companies with assets under $5 billion, not involved in significant nonbanking activities or holding substantial public debt. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System will adjust the dollar amount in the Small Bank Holding Company Policy Statement annually based on the percentage increase in total assets held by insured depository institutions. Additionally, they will propose revisions to the Policy Statement within six months to address the increase in debt-to-equity ratio of small bank holding companies. The debt-to-equity ratio allowable for small bank holding companies to pay corporate dividends and remain eligible for expedited processing procedures under Regulation Y would increase from 1:1 to 3:1. SEC. 3. ESCROW REQUIREMENTS. Amends Truth in Lending Act to exempt smaller creditors from certain loan requirements. SEC. 4. EXCEPTION TO ANNUAL PRIVACY NOTICE REQUIREMENT UNDER THE GRAMM-LEACH-BLILEY ACT. Section 503 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act is amended to provide an exception to the annual notice requirement for financial institutions that meet specific criteria. SEC. 5 amends the Securities Act of 1933 to require cost-benefit analyses for new accounting principles. SEC. 6 exempts community banks from the Sarbanes-Oxley Act's annual management assessment of internal controls requirement. Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 is amended to exempt insured depository institutions with total assets of $10,000,000,000 or less from certain requirements. The Commission will adjust the dollar amount annually based on the percentage increase in total assets held by depository institutions. Section 129C(b)(2) of the Truth in Lending Act is amended to require that loans be held in portfolio for at least 3 years by creditors with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets. The Bureau will regulate this provision. Creditors extending balloon loans must retain them in portfolio for a minimum of 3 years and have total assets of $10,000,000,000 or less. SEC. 8. INCREASE IN SMALL SERVICER EXEMPTION. The Bureau will provide exemptions or adjustments for servicers with 20,000 or fewer mortgage loans to reduce regulatory burdens while maintaining consumer protections. SEC. 9. APPRAISER QUALIFICATION THRESHOLD. SEC. 9. APPRAISER QUALIFICATION THRESHOLD. Amends the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 to establish a threshold level of $250,000 for transactions. Each regulatory agency may set a higher threshold. Section 5333 of title 31, United States Code, amends coordination among financial institutions regarding automated clearing house entries. Receiving depository financial institutions are not required to verify prohibited transactions if the originating depository financial institution has warranted compliance with Office of Foreign Assets Control sanctions programs. A clearing house is a funds transfer system for interbank clearing of electronic entries for depository financial institutions, including insured depository institutions, eligible depository institutions, insured credit unions, and eligible credit unions. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to funds transfer through an automated clearing house, including entry, originating depository financial institution, and prohibited transaction. The curr_chunk defines the term 'receiving depository financial institution' in the context of a sanctions program administered by the Office of Foreign Assets Control. The curr_chunk discusses coordination among financial institutions.
